title: As Shutdown Nears End, Trump Still Confronts Soaring Health Costs
summary: The central issue of the government closure remains unresolved, leaving Republicans under political pressure ahead of the midterms.

title: Trump Lauds ‘Very Big’ Shutdown Victory for G.O.P. in Veterans Day Speech
summary: The address mixed the traditional solemnity of the day with political arguments, as the president celebrated his efforts to remake the armed services into a “Department of War.”

title: Flight Delays and Cancellations Won’t Immediately Stop When Government Shutdown Ends
summary: There is hope the Thanksgiving holiday will be spared, but carriers will need some time to deal with the disruptions that the shutdown has caused for air travel.

title: Private Aviation Has Boomed During the Government Shutdown
summary: As the government’s closure drags on, commercial airline passengers are suffering. But private aviation is doing banner business.

title: Some Kansas Republicans Resist Redistricting Efforts Amid Growing Skepticism
summary: The state’s top Republicans wanted to join President Trump’s push to redraw congressional maps. But plans for a special session fell apart when some lawmakers resisted.

title: Judge Rejects Utah’s Republican-Drawn Redistricting Map
summary: The judge instead adopted a map drawn by a centrist coalition. Democrats celebrated the ruling ahead of the 2026 midterms, but Republicans vowed to fight it.

title: A State-by-State Guide to the Gerrymandering Fight for Congress
summary: A redistricting arms race, started by President Trump’s push to redraw Texas maps in Republicans’ favor, continues, but it may be reaching its limits.

title: How the Heavy-Metal Fall of a Dictator Shapes Trump’s Venezuela Plans
summary: Seizing Panama’s leader was relatively easy. But the similarities between Panama and Venezuela are dangerously misleading, some analysts warn.

title: Senator Criticizes Rubio for Paying $7.5 Million to Equatorial Guinea to Take Deportees
summary: Senator Jeanne Shaheen, Democrat of New Hampshire, said the African country has a long history of corruption. The amount paid is far more than recent annual assistance given to it.

title: Halt in Fees on Chinese Vessels Endangers U.S. Shipbuilding Efforts
summary: The two countries agreed to suspend the fees for a year as part of their recent trade pact, but America still aims to build more commercial ships.

title: Trump Wants to Revive Shipping. He Will Need More Mariners.
summary: Few American are becoming mariners today, but demand could soon rise because President Trump and a bipartisan group of legislators in Congress want to revitalize the American shipbuilding industry.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Hit Specialty Grocery Stores for Some Immigrant Communities Especially Hard
summary: For immigrant communities from countries with especially high duties, food costs have risen sharply courtesy of President Trump.

title: Accused of Desecration, a Doctor Faces the End of His Life’s Work
summary: Dr. Masahide Kanayama has devoted his life in Manhattan to medicine and God. He could face five years of hard labor in Japan.

title: Archbishop Paul Coakley Is Picked to Lead American Bishops
summary: “We face a growing worldview that is so often at odds with the Gospel mandate to love thy neighbor,” the group said in a letter to Pope Leo.

title: Key Netanyahu Minister Steps Down From Israel’s Government
summary: Ron Dermer, a longtime ally of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and an influential figure in the Israeli government throughout the war in Gaza, resigned as minister of strategic affairs.

title: Israel Arrests 4 After Jewish Extremist Attack in West Bank
summary: Dozens of masked Israelis attacked an industrial zone, torching vehicles and wounding Palestinians, according to Palestinian officials.

title: Justice Department to Investigate Protests at Turning Point Event at Berkeley
summary: The announcement came a day after protesters confronted attendees of a campus event hosted by Turning Point USA, the conservative group founded by Charlie Kirk.

title: N.Y.C. Casino Bids Promise an Economic Boom. The Reality Might Differ.
summary: As the number of gambling houses has grown across the United States, they are no longer the tourism magnets that they used to be, experts say.

title: Over 30,000 Miles, a Midwife Navigates West Virginia’s Maternity Deserts
summary: In a state where women drive hours to obstetricians, Staysha Quentrill is part of a small group trying to revive a tradition of community-based care.

title: Cleto Escobedo III, Jimmy Kimmel’s Bandleader, Dies at 59
summary: Mr. Kimmel said that he and Mr. Escobedo, who led Cleto and the Cletones on “Jimmy Kimmel Live!,” had been “inseparable since I was 9 years old.”

title: Meet the New Antisemites, Same as the Old Antisemites
summary: A bigotry for morons will always be political gold in a world of morons.

title: On Veterans Day, This Is the Lonely, Terrible Sorrow We Must Never Forget
summary: To imagine the cost of an “America First” policy, walk through World War II cemeteries in Europe.

title: Trump Threatened to Sue the BBC for $1 Billion. What Are His Chances?
summary: Legal experts say President Trump’s litigation track record offers both hope and warning to the British public broadcaster, which he has threatened with a $1 billion suit.

title: Infant Formula Recall Expands as Botulism Outbreak Grows
summary: Federal health officials said caregivers should stop using all ByHeart powdered formula products after 15 infants in 12 states were hospitalized.

title: Pope Leo Shares His Favorite Movies Ahead of Vatican Event
summary: The list leans heavily on uplifting classics.

title: Head of N.Y.P.D. Oversight Board Resigns, Citing Pressure From Union
summary: Dr. Mohammad Khalid, the interim chairman of the Civilian Complaint Review Board, said a “campaign of lies” about him by the head of the police union had forced him to quit.
